001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers.JavaNumberTypeSupport;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.common.utils.Floats;
006
007/**
008 * Binary Cross-Entropy (BCE) loss function.
009 * <p>
010 * This loss function is used for binary classification tasks
011 * where each output neuron predicts the probability of a binary label
012 * (0 or 1) using a {@code sigmoid} activation function.
013 * It computes the cross-entropy between the predicted probability
014 * and the target label.
015 * </p>
016 *
017 * <h3>Definition</h3>
018 * For a single output:
019 * <pre>
020 *     E = - [ y * log(a) + (1 - y) * log(1 - a) ]
021 * </pre>
022 * where:
023 * <ul>
024 *   <li>{@code y} is the true label in {0,1}</li>
025 *   <li>{@code a} is the predicted probability (sigmoid output)</li>
026 * </ul>
027 *
028 * <h3>Gradients</h3>
029 * The derivative of the BCE loss with respect to the output activation {@code a} is:
030 * <pre>
031 *     dE/da = -( y / a - (1 - y) / (1 - a) )
032 * </pre>
033 * When combined with the derivative of the sigmoid activation {@code f'(z) = a(1 - a)},
034 * this simplifies to the familiar error signal:
035 * <pre>
036 *     δ = a - y
037 * </pre>
038 *
039 * <h3>Usage</h3>
040 * <ul>
041 *   <li>Output layer: one sigmoid unit per target</li>
042 *   <li>Loss function: {@code BinaryCrossEntropy}</li>
043 *   <li>Training: use the error signals δ = a - y as the starting point for backpropagation</li>
044 * </ul>
045 *
046 * <h3>Numerical stability</h3>
047 * To avoid {@code log(0)} or division by zero, a small epsilon (e.g. 1e-7)
048 * should be added when clamping predicted probabilities {@code a} into (0,1).
049 */
050@Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
051public class BinaryCrossEntropy<N extends Number> implements DimensionLossFunction<N> {
052
053    private final JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport;
054
055    public BinaryCrossEntropy(JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport) {
056        this.typeSupport = typeSupport;
057    }
058
059    /**
060     * {@inheritDoc}
061     */
062    @Override
063    public N calculateDimensionLoss(N estimated, N target) {
064        N a = typeSupport.clamp01(estimated); // predicted probability
065        N y = target; // true label
066
067        // a + epsilon
068        N aPlusEps = typeSupport.add(a, typeSupport.epsilon());
069        // 1 - a
070        N oneMinusA = typeSupport.subtract(typeSupport.one(), a);
071        // 1 - y
072        N oneMinusY = typeSupport.subtract(typeSupport.one(), y);
073        // 1 - a + epsilon
074        N oneMinusAPlusEps = typeSupport.add(oneMinusA, typeSupport.epsilon());
075
076        // log(a + epsilon)
077        N logA = typeSupport.log(aPlusEps);
078        // log(1 - a + epsilon)
079        N logOneMinusA = typeSupport.log(oneMinusAPlusEps);
080
081        // y * log(a + epsilon)
082        N yLogA = typeSupport.multiply(y, logA);
083        // (1 - y) * log(1 - a + epsilon)
084        N oneMinusYLogOneMinusA = typeSupport.multiply(oneMinusY, logOneMinusA);
085
086        // sum
087        N sum = typeSupport.add(yLogA, oneMinusYLogOneMinusA);
088
089        // -sum
090        return typeSupport.negate(sum);
091    }
092
093    /**
094     * {@inheritDoc}
095     */
096    public N calculateGradient_dl_da(N estimated, N target) {
097        N a = typeSupport.clamp01(estimated);
098        N y = target;
099        // a + epsilon
100        N aPlusEps = typeSupport.add(a, typeSupport.epsilon());
101        // 1 - a
102        N oneMinusA = typeSupport.subtract(typeSupport.one(), a);
103        // 1 - a + epsilon
104        N oneMinusAPlusEps = typeSupport.add(oneMinusA, typeSupport.epsilon());
105        // 1 - y
106        N oneMinusY = typeSupport.subtract(typeSupport.one(), y);
107
108        // y / (a + epsilon)
109        N yOverA = typeSupport.divide(y, aPlusEps);
110        // (1 - y) / (1 - a + epsilon)
111        N oneMinusYOverOneMinusA = typeSupport.divide(oneMinusY, oneMinusAPlusEps);
112        // y / (a + epsilon) - (1 - y) / (1 - a + epsilon)
113        N diff = typeSupport.subtract(yOverA, oneMinusYOverOneMinusA);
114        // -(...)
115        return typeSupport.negate(diff);
116    }
117
118    /**
119     * {@inheritDoc}
120     */
121    @Override
122    public JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> getNumberTypeSupport() {
123        return typeSupport;
124    }
125}
